byline.contributor: Trip Gabriel reported from Des Moines, and Jonathan Martin from Washington.
byline.original: By TRIP GABRIEL and JONATHAN MARTIN

abstract: Wisconsin Gov Scott Walker, lagging in presidential race, plans to reposition himself as enemy of status quo in order to compete for supporters of Donald J Trump's candidacy; Walker has suffered greatly as Trump has ascended, particularly in Iowa, where he once was frontrunner.
lead_paragraph: The challenge for Mr. Walker is whether by repositioning himself not only as a slayer of Democrats, but also of his own party’s establishment, he can recapture voter support in the state.

headline.main: Momentum Slipping Away in Iowa, Scott Walker Adopts a Trump-Like Stance
headline.print_headline: Momentum Slipping Away in Iowa, Walker Adopts a Trump-Like Stance

snippet: The challenge for Mr. Walker is whether by repositioning himself not only as a slayer of Democrats, but also of his own party’s establishment, he can recapture voter support in the state.
